dialogues.speaker: JOE THERRIAN
dialogues.text: He's in his mid-thirties, his face relaxed in sleep, childlike.  Nestled soundly a tangle in the arms of his w

dialogues.speaker: SALLY THERRIAN
dialogues.text: She's in her mid-thirties, with large deep eyes.  She wat her husband unguarded in sleep.  Her pretty face, alert, she's barely breathing.  Traces the just visible lines ar his eyes, and mouth.  Brushes fingertips against his eyelashes. TIGHT CLOSE - SALLY'S HAND PULLS THE BEDROOM SHADE. It retracts with a loud WHACK, sun, sky, trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And breath...and chataronga...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in the middle of a yoga lesson.  Joe and Sally stan their mats.  Steven, their instructor, wanders around the couple issuing soft-spoken instructions. A large room with hard wood floors, dominated by a huge fireplace.  The dining room on one side, living room on t other.  Floor to ceiling windows overlook the back porch garden pool... The house is classic Neutra.  All GLASS an SMOOTH LINES. The calm is broken by the telephone.  Joe and Sally ignor until the answering machine picks up.  They break their y poses and listen. The CAMERA hovers over the answering machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over answering machine; sweet, British, slightly desperate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, it's Lucy.  Remember me?  It's the black sheep here.  Bah...not funny. Haven't heard from you, need you, call me.  Love you madly.  Hi, Sally.  Joe, I'd love to talk to you before I go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over answering machine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a damn nuisance you aren't here, big brother.  Sorry I drone on.  I miss you. I lo-- The machine cuts her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe and Sally have resumed their positions.  This wasn't call they were waiting for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMERICA, forty-one, and ROSA, fifty, struggle up the step the back porch carrying grocery bags and packages, come through the sliding glass door...

dialogues.speaker: THE CAMERA FOLLOWS THEM
dialogues.text: Through the dining room and into the kitchen, watches the unpack groceries, flowers, etc., and start to dress the dining room table.  They speak quietly to each other in Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: America, could you just... America closes the sliding doors between the kitchen and dining room, giving the couple their privacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, America! STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's just take a deep breath, let your ribs expand and relax.  And reach up and into downward dog. Otis, the Bisenji/Sheperd mix, sleeping on his leopard pillow, stirs, stretches and groans. JOE AND SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good boy, Otis. The phone RINGS again. VOICE (O.S.) (over answering machine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, I have Dr. Harmon calling for Sally Therrian. Sally jumps out of the down dog position and runs to the phone, all angles. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, hi, hi...and?  Thank God. Sally stands with the phone to her ear, her back to Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe watches her from his position, not concentrating on t teacher waiting a sign.  Sally returns to the lesson.  Th do their handstands against the wall, on either side of t front door. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No luck. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well, we'll just have to try again. Sound like a plan? Sally nods, she and Joe, at Steven's instructions, come o of their handstands and lie on the floor in a stretched relax, facing one another. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy anniversary, baby. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy anniversary. They smile. STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And change sides... America slides open the dining room doors.  The dining ta is covered with bundles of freshly cut flowers.  Rosa is singing in Spanish. AMERICA (with the authority of long years of service)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Joe, we have to have the house.  If you please now... JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's yours. The CAMERA glances off photos of the couple: portraits an candids, their wedding day, with friends, on vacation, tumbling on the lawn, and the like. Some framed and hung, some taped to the fridge or simply leaning on a shelf.  It's clear that at least a handful a by the same photographer, black and whites, grainy and beautiful. There are lots of photos of Joe and his sister Lucy, documenting their relationship from childhood.  There's a ANNIE LEIBOWITZ photo-shoot of Sally carelessly displayed somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe stands behind Sally in front of the full length mirro his arms around her, stroking her belly. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.  Most beautiful woman in the world. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardly... JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accept a compliment. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're the most beautiful woman in the world. They move toward the bed. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you get me? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the morning, after everyone's gone and there's just us. She pushes him on the bed. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss my eyes. She does. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wrists. He does. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss the back of my knees. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the sweats or not? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not. She pulls down his sweats.  She kisses the back of his kn He turns, stares up at her. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't kiss anyone else's knees, did you? Sally shakes her head. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Did you? JOE (after a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I missed that. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed all of you.  We're okay, aren't we? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're great. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, you're really back. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For good. They begin to make love...the phone RINGS. JOE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get it. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it might be Clair.  They're threatening not to come... JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't find a sitter... (into the receiver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?  Excuse me?  Yes, uh, hold on. (she looks at Joe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a moment. (puts the call on hold)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Skye Davidson.  She needs directions to the house.  You invited Skye fucking Davidson to our anniversary party? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  I'm sorry, look, I meant to tell you.  It was the only chance I had to meet her. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You invited her to our anniversary party? I didn't even invite my mother. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes on location tomorrow.  Sally, I'm sorry.  Look, I can't keep her on hold. SALLY (pissed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no of course not.  It's Skye fucking Davidson, for fuck's sake. JOE (regards her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to uninvite her? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no of course not.  How old is she? Twenty-fucking-two? She gets out of bed, starts into the bathroom.  The CAMER with her. SALLY (CONT'D) (into the bathroom mirror)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she's a stinking fucking actress, for fuck's sake. JOE (into the receiver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skye! (his face lights)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so glad you're able to make it...it's our sixth, actually. (flattered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You read the book again?  Well, no, the ending to chapter six...it's just that it's not filmic. We tried it in an earlier draft, but, it just wasn't filmic... Well, sure, we can absolutely look at that again.  If you're coming from Laurel, you want to take Sunset west, we're just past Will Rogers State Park.  Three blocks west of that, you want to hang right.  It's about three quarters of a mile up a big white thing on the left. Sally's started the bath, and is watching him from the doorway.  He meets her eyes mid-sentence. JOE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?  I don't think tonight.  I'm sure they're well behaved.  All our friends have dogs, and they always want to bring them.  We'd be outnumbered, you see?  So we sort of put a ban on it.  Sorry. He rolls his eyes.  Sally walks back into the bathroom, s isn't buying it. JOE (O.S.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking forward to meeting you, too. And Skye, I'm thrilled that you're willing to take this leap with me. Eternally grateful, really. SALLY (into the bathroom mirror)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to throw up. JOE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't imagine anyone else playing Genna. SALLY (sanguine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorbell rings.  There are two closed doors on either side of the room.  The bed shows no sign of consummated s Joe comes through the left hand door, nearly dressed. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck can be here at this time? It's not even seven! Sally comes through the other door, one shoe off, one on. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus, who else is always early for Christ's sake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally kisses his cheek on her way to the door. SALLY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise you'll be nice to the neighbors. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll say as little as possible. Sally exits the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: HOLD ON JOE
dialogues.text: For a moment, then Sally re-enters, kisses him deeply. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is filled with exquisite flower arrangements, candles everywhere. JERRY and JUDY ADAMS are on the porch, just beyond the gl of the front door.  Their argument is inaudible.  They're their mid-thirties, conservatively dressed.  She's stunni genetically nervous.  Jerry carries a briefcase.  She's g the gift. Sally opens the door.  Hugs and buses them, hello. JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know we're early, we're so early. Sorry. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to sign your taxes anyway. SALLY (a grin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course we do. (to Judy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to sign our taxes. JOE (kisses Judy; all charm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can never be too early or too thin. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy anniversary, buddy!  Six months ago, who would have thunk it? Jerry hugs Joe. JOE (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, not me, to be honest. JERRY (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fuck up again.  It's got a ripple effect.  Sally suffers, we all suffer. JUDY (offers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a gift? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, I'll take that.  Champagne? JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lovely. Joe moves toward the kitchen. JERRY (a moment, to Sally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We closed. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic. (takes his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out here. They step out onto the porch.  Judy's left alone, unsure whether to follow or not. JUDY (finally, to no one, and to no response)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house looks beautiful, are those hydrangeas? She stands awkwardly in the middle of the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe officially owns No. 4, Cheyenne Walk, Chelsea, London, England.  No small doing. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, you're a genius. Behind them, in the foyer, Judy wanders aimlessly. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose.  Sally, that's quite a gift. I'm not sure it's in your best interest. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I adore him. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The realtor'll be here tomorrow in the morning.  The house had to go on the market to insure the loan on the London flat. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  I know that.  Don't spoil it. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you earn has to double in order to cover expenses in London, it's an outrageously expensive city. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've only been over this how many times? JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You only made half your quote this year. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're a tower of support. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worry because you don't.  It's my job. I'm feeling guilty.  I would've liked it if you waited until the two of you were on more solid ground. SALLY (direct, simple)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We couldn't be on more solid ground. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say.  Listen, I love you. Otis is barking. JOE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otis!  No barking! SALLY (touched)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Joe's huge in Europe.  He's like a rock star in London.  His novels sell millions. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not millions. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's directing now. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're paying him scale. The CAMERA catches sight of Joe behind them.  He moves through the foyer and into the living room with a tray of glasses and Judy in tow. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets huge advances on his novels. He's going back to that.  You know how he hates it here. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's still time to undo this. SALLY (kisses his cheek)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be fine. JERRY (re: barking dog)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you invite them? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Roses?  And of course they said yes. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the plan.  And you're thrilled to have them. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell Joe to behave? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he promise? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout's honor. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before I forget. (pulls a novel from his briefcase)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it on the bookshelf. She flips the book -- on the back is a full page picture RYAN ROSE. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out of your mind. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do what I say, alright? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much bowing and scraping do you want us to do? JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beats a lawsuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe and Judy sit on opposite sides of the sofa -- slightl uncomfortable with each other. JOE (to fill the silence, conspiratorial grin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love gifts.  What did you guys get us? JUDY (chokes on the champagne)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing that can't be exchanged. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Well.  Good. JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations on the deal.  How exciting.  Is Sally doing Sally?  I mean it's Sally.  The character that's based on Sally.  The character that's based on Sally in the book. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The novel.  No, Skye Davidson is playing the lead. JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, I'm a huge Skye Davidson fan. She's very beautiful. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, she is. JUDY (trying harder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I am right, yes?  She's based on Sally. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a novel. JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still.  Well.  Let's drop it. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not much of a reader, but I do love autobiographies, even biographies sometimes.  Mostly non-fiction.  Did you read the new Styron? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very good. (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand you won the Booker Prize. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I did. JUDY (another moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your script much like the novel? Jerry says it's very good.  But you know, you read the novel, and then you see the movie - and most of the time you say, "what's this?" You know?  I sometimes think we're better off not reading the novel at all.  Because, we come with expectations... and of course, we know where we're going.  Don't you find? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't I find what? JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why Joe, we've known each other how long... JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not long. JUDY (benign)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be silly. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joking. JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I know.  I started to say... I started to say Joe that -- JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I put you off? JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You manage to throw me off balance.  I adore you. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I you. JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm always afraid I'll say something stupid. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so I always manage to, do you see? Like the book/script thing, do you see? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm hmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAL and SOPHIA GOLD are there with their children - JACK EVIE - eight and six respectively.  Carrying gifts and to with toys and changes.  Jerry and Sally have gathered the and ushered them in. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Jerry. CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the wife.  We've met. JERRY (hugs her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, I know. SALLY (to Evie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, beautiful girl. She picks up the four-year-old, swings her around.  Jack hides behind his father's legs. SOPHIA (a grin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack?  Jack, you promised. The little boy comes out from behind his father's legs, covers his eyes with his hands. JACK (sings)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy anniversary to you.  We're glad Joe came home.  Don't split up again.  Cause we like the food. Much laughter and clapping. JOE (in the archway)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack.  Did you compose that yourself? CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had a little help? CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely not. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has your ring. CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not that good. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal, my wife Judy. JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you. CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we've met, actually.  No?  At another one of these things? JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't think so. JERRY (to Cal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations on the Academy Award. Great performance.  Really warranted. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thought so. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally always manages to get robbed. SALLY (a mortified grin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough about me. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evie has a little something for you. Evie shakes her head. SOPHIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do. EVIE (even)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when are you so shy? EVIE (her mother's daughter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never. SOPHIA (bright smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, we have gifts for you and all sorts of surprises.  Where is America?  I know she's here somewhere. Joe reaches for the gifts. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take them. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I have a little talking to do with America.  Privately.  I'll find her. SALLY (to Sophia)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the kitchen. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who'd like to go and find Otis? EVIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me! JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess. JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The infamous dog? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the best dog in the world. (to Judy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're both coming tonight.  Not my idea. JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ours. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Jerry's worst idea. CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The neighbors from hell.  The kind that lay in wait.  I'd rather move actually. Wouldn't I? (to Sally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't I? SALLY (small smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. JOE (to the kids)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Last one to find Otis is a smelly old bum. Joe goes off with the children to find Otis.  Cal sits at piano, plays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe holds Evie in one arm.  Jack stands beside him, holds hand.  MONICA and RYAN ROSE face him across the threshold the NEXT DOOR NEIGHBORS.  She's in her late twenties - an beautiful, eyes everywhere - star struck and house struck Ryan is somewhat older, a little awkward in company, swallowing resentment and a little self righteous. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hello you two. (putting Evie down; to Jack)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the people who live next door. Say hello. Jack does. JOE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And close the door, Jack.  Because if we leave it open, Otis will run out and you know what will happen then? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, uh. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll run next door into their backyard and he'll bark and bark and bark and eat their pitbull for his dinner.  Is it a pitbull? RYAN (not amused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, actually. JOE (to Jack)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh whatever.  We don't want that to happen, do we? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a rottweiler, actually. (to Jack)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think our rottweiler is in any danger, Jack. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Jack and I are very relieved. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought this was a party.  Are we going to talk about the dog thing? MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Ryan. JOE (kisses her cheek and shakes his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's absolutely right.  You're absolutely right, Ryan.  Dog talk must be banned.  Canine conversations are completely discouraged... it's really good of you to join us.  Can I get you a drink? RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for me, thanks. An awkward moment. MONICA (checks with Ryan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something soft. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right away.  Are you sure you wouldn't like something soft, Ryan? RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure, yes. Sally has watched some of this from the archway, joins th super-friendly. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  Monica and Ryan? MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  And you've met Joe. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. SALLY (a deep breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, so glad you decided to come. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could hardly say no. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? Joe slips the coke into Monica's hand. SALLY (CONT'D) (takes the gift)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  This was so unnecessary.  I hope you've noticed that Otis isn't barking as much.  We keep him in at night. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At 4:30 today he barked for a solid fifteen minutes.  I have it on tape. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're keeping a record, are you? RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just very distracting when you're trying to work. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan. RYAN (to Joe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you understand. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well the neighborhood is full of dogs, and it's not always Otis. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well today it was Otis.  And you should keep him away from our yard.  Because Sheila will defend herself. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan! SALLY (cuts off response from Joe; to Ryan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you working on a new book? RYAN (caught short; flattered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yes, actually. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He always has two or three going... SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  Joe can't manage more than one at a time.  With huge gaps in between.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAC and CLAIR FORSYTHE wave from the door.  Clair's arms full of presents.  Mac carries three video cameras under arm.  He's got Otis by the collar. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lose this? JOE (re: Otis)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah there's our snookums now. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, well, but I haven't won a Booker either.  Or the Whitebread. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gate was open. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, not yet. (she reacts to Mac)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gate was open? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's taken care of. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Ryan needs a new publisher.  I think he's outgrown him.  They're just not doing their job. A silence.  Awkward smiles go all around. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hors d'oeuvres or something? MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, great!  It's a beautiful house. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  I understand you're an interior decorator. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I so wish I'd known. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, whoever did this is amazing. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did it. JOE (comes on them with the Forsythes in tow)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rarely cops to it. (kisses Sally's cheek)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otis is home. CLAIR (re: the gifts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where can I put these? Sally takes the gifts from her. CLAIR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a fucking day!  We only just got a sitter.  I don't know her from fucking Adam.  She could be a serial killer.  I'm going to have to call every ten minutes. You have to let me give out the number. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She already has. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright, isn't it? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it's alright. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clair is a hovering mother. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Monica and Ryan.  Mac and Clair. Clair takes a glass of champagne off the tray as they mak their way down the hall. CLAIR (a wide professionally ingratiating smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So nice... MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And for us... Truly. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will never know. CLAIR (pleased)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. (to Sally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a four-thirty call.  AM.  So we may have to leave early. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you bring him? CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you bring him? CLAIR (searches)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's allergic. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To dander.  Otis. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't I say? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, probably. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can tell from the eyelashes, you know?  He's got eyelashes yay long.  They must be a foot long.  The older you are when you have a baby, the more likely this stuff is to crop up. SALLY (muted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. The Roses are happy to stand there on the fringe.  Next t someone they've only seen on screen and magazine covers. Clair's not in the least put off by them.  She manages to smile at them inclusively from time to time. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So they tell me.  Not soon enough, of course. (kisses her cheek)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you, Sal?  You look fantastic. It changes your life, you know.  A baby. It puts everything in perspective, doesn't it.  Doesn't it, Mac?  You can't be the center of your own world, anymore. MAC (as grounded as Clair isn't)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an object lesson in grace. (on seeing Cal Gold on the back porch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow!  Look who's here before me!  My leading man is on time for once. CAL (at the piano)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those who can't direct. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac and Cal sit on the porch sharing a joint.  Cal is may the only living complete works of Shakespeare and pulls o his most arcane quotes on occasion. CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are those our dailies?  You're totally outrageous.  It's their anniversary.  Is nothing sacred!  Well...so...how am I? MAC (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man, you are so fucking funny in the kitchen scene. CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked the third take, the accidental disaster with the silverware. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing you do is accidental...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA spots GINA TAYLOR through moving bodies.  Tall beautiful, centered grace.  She's got a Leica around her neck... drops her two large camera bags on the floor. Several of the other guests greet her, Mac among them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe sweeps her up to his arms.  It's an intimate, appreciative embrace.  Theirs was a mid-30s relationship, certainly pre-Sally.  Maybe his first important love. GINA (re: the cameras)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the hired help. JOE (affectionate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never put myself in harm's way. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anymore. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not anymore.  Happy anniversary, scout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia bursts from the kitchen. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!  America told me your neighbors are coming? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here they are! SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she was saying how happy you were to finally have them over.  Because you're both, so, what - introspective?  And you should have done it ages ago.  I'm Sophia Gold. (rescuing Sally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come meet my husband, Cal. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal Gold? SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The very one.  And you are... SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica and Ryan. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry? RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan Rose. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She shakes his hand.  He's amazed at the solid grip. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a novelist. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Joe. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm. (to Sally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are my kids? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the guest room.  I've laid out a paint table for them. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope they're watercolors! SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nevermind. SOPHIA (to Monica)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to meet my husband? It's all Monica can do to keep from putting her hand to h chest. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be thrilled. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he'll be thrilled. She ushers them toward the living room. JOE (re: Sophia, appreciative)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's such pure evil. Sally approaches, gives Gina a warm kiss on the chest. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy anniversary.  You're a good match, you two. (to Joe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you help me with this stuff? JOE (re: one of her bags)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That for us? GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a nose.  You missed your calling. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I open it? GINA (defers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's impossible.  Go on then. Joe rips open the gift.  It's a framed black and white of Joe, Sally and Otis lying on the couch.  It's clear which photos in the house are Gina's.  It's a breathtaking prin an amazing caught moment.  All light and shadow.  A touch study. SALLY (CONT'D) (respectful of the talent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful, thank you so much. Joe, moved somehow, hugs Gina to him.  Kisses her. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you,  Gina Taylor. Sally's uncomfortable, a little jealous... feels intrusiv Aware that Gina got there first.  Knew him when.  And alw captures something naked and vulnerable in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the center of the room a low table with paints and cra and glue and baubles.  Two child size chairs either side. Empty, the table hasn't been touched. Evie stands against the far wall.  She wears a helmet and surrounded by toy suction arrows.  The arrows make a perf outline of her head and body.  Jack stands three feet awa bow in hand -- the archer prepares his next shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal is at the piano, charming the neighbors.  Judy chats Mac.  Jerry is on his cellphone, holding his Palm Pilot, hand pressed against his ear to block out the chatter.  S joins Cal on the piano stool.  Sophia moves to Clair on t couch, kisses her cheek. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look so well, Clair.  A wraith. CLAIR (pleased)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think so!?  I've been working out a lot since the baby. And I've been working.  And that takes it's toll, you know. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad that's all over for me. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you miss it? SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for a second.  Cal can have all that. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where is young Jonah? CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a sitter.  We have a sensational sitter.  Jonah's really comfortable with her.  You know, a second mom sort of. Like part of the family.  Amazing with kids. She inadvertently touches the beeper on her belt, and it beeps.  She jumps. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that thing? CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this sitter can always reach me.  I'm still not used to leaving him. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have brought him. CLAIR (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dander.  He's allergic.  Otis. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Do you have any pictures? CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pictures.  They're always in my tote.  I left my tote in the damn trailer.  But! He's Mac all over again.  Imagine Mac shrunk to two-and-a-half feet.  The fact is they probably didn't even need me for this birth. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you the funniest person I know, or what? CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't think how you gave it all up, Soph. Sophia sends her a soft, content smile.  Otis comes over nuzzles Clair's knee. CLAIR (CONT'D) (freeks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, the dog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clair leads Sally towards the bedroom. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds hysterical, but Otis just rubbed up against me and I'd kind of like to change into something of yours.  You know it could be disaster.  He's so allergic.  It's terrifying. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borrow whatever you like. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll change back before we leave. SALLY (pointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you like.  I'm afraid it'll all be too big for you. (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright, Clair? CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.  I'm fine.  Well, I'm a little stressed.  And I've been taking pills to get my weight down since the baby. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say it was down. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the doctor said they might make me a little jumpy.  I've got a ghastly headache, actually. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a Tylenol, or something? CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love a Xanex. (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally, please don't tell Sophia that I'm not breast feeding. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would she care? CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Sophia.  She's so damned judgemental.  And she's so damned... perfect.  And so fucking... serene.  Just fucking don't tell her.  Because you know Mac thinks she's God.  And I can feel him comparing. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to knock off the pills, Clair. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't fucking tell her. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not going to come up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Peter Sellers look-a-like holding a violin case. JOE (opens the door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panes!  How are you? PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you know, I am. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has she called? PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll never call again.  She called last week to tell me she'll never call again. Where's Sally? SALLY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here I am.  Panes, my love! Sally starts down the hallway. SALLY (CONT'D) (for Panes; a long supportive hug; a kiss)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, you brought your violin.  I want you to play. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a machine gun.  I thought I'd kill myself. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you lovesick? PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suicidal.  It's much less codependent. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will champagne help? PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not enough. Sally takes Panes into the living room where everyone cha drinks, smokes.  They all like each other out of habit, i nothing else.  Ryan and Monica are on the fringe, stand a the edges of conversation.  There's always someone at the piano, and they can all pretty much play. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panes is here! PANES (gives everyone a shy, pained little wave)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh great. Everyone stops, turns, toasts. EVERYONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panes! MONICA/RYAN (a little late; into silence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panes. Panes gives them another little wave.  Doorbell rings.

dialogues.speaker: SKYE DAVIDSON
dialogues.text: SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. She's the young, beautiful actress who'll play the lead i Joe's film. JOE (his face lights up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skye! She's in jeans, but somehow looks dressed to the 9s. SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Joe, aren't you? (nods knowingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I recognized you from the book jacket. Joe grins from ear to ear.  Uncharacteristically star str in front of this beauty. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do, Skye? SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I love that. (throws arms around him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just great.  I'm so happy to be here. And I apologize for invading you.  And I'm so happy you asked me to.  I'm so touched.  I know how private you and Sally are. JOE (uncomfortable)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, it's just us and a few hundred of our closest friends. SKYE (genuine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I read your work I felt that you knew me.  Women must tell you that.  And this one in particular speaks to me, do you know?  I am Genna.  How many women must tell you that.  And the script is wonderful.  Wonderful and lean and visual... JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so happy you like it.  I'm so relieved you said yes, and I'm really, um, what, thrilled, yes actually, to finally meet you. SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to be a remarkable director, a brilliant director. There's a long moment. JOE (finally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're my first Goddess. Sally and Panes have been watching from the living room. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's even better looking in the flesh. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  I need a drink.  Come hide with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: America and Rosa are working at the counter, Panes and Sa come through. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus, Panes.  I can't, I can't believe that bitch is in my house. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know she's a bitch. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's all over him, are you blind? PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be worse. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She could be playing the role in Joe's movie that should be yours. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Panes. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, that's worse. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted tonight to be with the people we love. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like your business managers? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not just our business managers, Panes. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, okay, forgive me.  Your neighbors are here, for fuck's sake. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly what I mean.  It's all ruined. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not ruined, for fuck's sake.  It's one of your parties. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want it to be just one of our parties. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "How are you really doing, Panes?" "Lousy, thank you, I'm falling apart." SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the last time. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No, not like the last time.  She was the rest of my life. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the last time. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't finished. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "We can't stand seeing you like this, Panes.  I hate you being alone.  Why don't you stay with us for a while?" "I'd love to, thanks." SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our anniversary, Panes. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't hear me say tonight. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just feeling our way back. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Otherwise, we'd insist on your being here." SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it's true. Skye bursts into the kitchen, Sally and Panes freeze. SKYE (stuck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, sorry.  I'm interrupting. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right out. PANES (over Sally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in. SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in the same room with Sally Nash.  Oh my God.  You're my icon.  I've been watching your films since I was a little girl.  Like, four years ago I followed you all around the Beverly Center - at least half a day, working up the courage to introduce myself. Joe enters the kitchen, watches. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I ever spent half a day in the Beverly Center. SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever, do you remember?  I've seen all your movies.  When I was in rehab, the second time, they wouldn't even let us see your drug addict movie.  They said you were too real.  I worship you.  And I couldn't be more flattered, because I know the part I'm playing in Joe's movie is based on you as a young woman. Joe winces, uncomfortable, picks up the bottle of wine an leaves. SKYE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm overwhelmed.  And I want to do it justice.  And I hope we can spend time together.  And I'm gushing.  It's my worst quality. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all. SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god.  I've been so rude.  I'm Skye Davidson.  Has anyone ever told you, you look like Peter Sellers? PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, never. SALLY (overlapping Panes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyday. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Levi Panes.  Will you excuse us, Skye?  It's time for Sally's meds. Panes steers Sally out of the kitchen. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nice to meet you... again. They go.  Skye is left in the kitchen alone. SKYE (to America)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, she remembers me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally and Panes start down the hall in search of privacy. SALLY (under her breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, thank you, thank you. CLAIR (on the way down; a dream in white)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, your wardrobe is incredible.  It took me forever to decide.  Oh, and I found Dr. X, thank you.  You saved my life. She moves past them. SALLY (a moment; sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! PANES (re: the dress)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd cut off her red wine if I were you. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.  It's my Galiano. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About five thousand dollars.  With my discount. The CAMERA follows them into the bedroom.  They flop down onto the bed and into FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More guests have arrived.  Sophia and her children play w Otis.  America and Rosa pass round hot hors d'oeuvres. Joe places Gina's photo on the mantelpiece. GINA (regards him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Directing suits you. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not so sure.  Look again in three months. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be nice having so many strangers kiss your ass all of a sudden. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!  Gina, you obviously need to get fucked. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just did.  Jealous? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When does he graduate high school? GINA (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, very jealous. Joe laughs. GINA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw Lucy when I was in London, she seems okay.  It's hard to tell with her. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, I forgot to call her back.  She's off on a trip somewhere.  Oh God, my grandad's flat in London's been sold. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Cheyene Walk?  Lucy's going to have a meltdown.  Oh, I'm so sorry. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have damn well bought it.  Well, we can't afford it.  The movie's going to eat up a year of my life and I'm getting paid next to nothing.  Do you know how much Skye Davidson's getting?  Four million. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I hear she gives a mean blow job. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really need to be fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how are you really doing, Panes? PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go fuck yourself? SALLY (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Really.  For real.  Really. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm worried about your Galiano. SALLY (slaps him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a shit. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, really, five thousand with your discount. He rolls out from under her swat, she misses him. PANES (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hurt, you know.  You're stronger than you think. They lie prone across the bed, about a foot apart. Contemplating the floor. PANES (CONT'D) (finally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the movie going?  Your movie.  You are making a movie, aren't you? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Fine. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?  Yes.  Fine? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about it. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never like to talk about my work. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.  Well, that's something new. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Not something new. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, something's wrong. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's wrong.  It's great, okay? Having the time of my life.  Mac's a fantastic director.  And what can anyone say about Cal that hasn't been said.  And it's great working with friends, blah blah blah. PANES (a moment; little smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um.  Happy for you. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me, how's it going? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you know.  No doubts.  No second thoughts.  Am I a monster? PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my best friend. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not an answer, is it? PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you're a monster. She takes his hand.  Sounds of the party come from below. SALLY (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Panes. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to thank me. SALLY (another moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to have to go back out there. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess. But neither of them moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANFORD JEWISON is at the piano playing his own stuff, oblivious to the din.  The CAMERA gets a glimpse of Ryan through the French doors at the pool, alone, a glass of Perrier in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica alone, uneasy, starts to pour herself a glass of champagne.  Jeffrey gets to the bottle first. JEFFREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me. (pours for her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Jeffrey. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica. JEFFREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know our friends, how? MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We live next door. JEFFREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  You're them. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? JEFFREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've heard lots about you. MONICA (lost)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy Adams lost herself a little, steps outside, sits alone... JUDY (smiles over at Ryan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  A little close in there. JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, narrow room.  Not much more than an alcove.  Wit space for a desk, stereo equipment, and shelves packed wi CDs.  The topmost shelf is a line of record albums. Joe's picking through the CDs.  Monica wanders in from th living room, toting a glass of champagne... watches him f moment. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Eames table is incredible.  And the B&B.  I just put that in a client's home, actually, but in red. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an interior decorator, right? MONICA (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally did all this herself? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fits and starts -- and then, later, of course, she had to accommodate me.  So things shifted a little bit then, became more eclectic.  And it keeps changing. MONICA (somehow at a loss)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm.  It says something about the two of you maybe. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're in a constant state of flux. (re: champagne)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you've moved up from the soft stuff. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes.  You know Ryan's been sober eight years.  And it's difficult if I... you know.  It's better if I don't. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a little nervous, so... JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little out of my element. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you're not. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yes.  Yes, in fact.  A little on the outside, yes.  And there's been all this friction. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why, but these misunderstandings have a way of escalating. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well put. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think a lot of this could have been avoided if Sally made more of an effort. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're very private people.  You know, there's a kind of elitism... JOE (pissed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elitism? MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wrong word, maybe.  Delete that. And, you know, the dog barks incessantly. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know, he really does not. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Ryan works at home. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your phone calls are nasty and abusive.  And I've come this close to suing you for harassment.  And you're only here because we're supposed to be sucking up to you. Her eyes well with tears. JOE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.  I'm sorry. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's what Ryan thought.  I was more generous, actually. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.  I'm sorry.  I'm a total fucking maniac.  Delete all that, okay?  I spoke for myself, this needn't rub off on my wife.  Oh shit.  I get pissy sometimes. Much worse than Otis.  Otis doesn't bite. It's just, I really love my dog and he doesn't really bark a lot. We live in a canyon.  We hear dogs barking at night, too.  And it's not Otis. Monica starts to laugh. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. It appears she's consumed more than one glass of champagn JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy tiger. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.  Please don't tell Ryan I'm drinking. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout's honor. MONICA (grins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be your best friend. She feels they've bonded.  She pulls a well-thumbed copy Joe's novel from her purse. MONICA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you sign it for me. (digs for a pen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure this is inappropriate. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're way past inappropriate. Monica giggles, presses back the bubble rising in her che and moving toward her throat.  Manages not to burp. MONICA (as he signs it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll treasure this. He moves towards the doorway, Monica at his heals. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to leave you now. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will treasure this. JOE (shouting down the hall)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally's team prepares clues for charades.  Sally writes t down, throws them in a bowler hat.  Her teammates are Pan Sophia, Mac, Ryan, Sanford and Jeffrey. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panes? PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Jewish Folk Poetry, a song cycle... MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust him. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Shostakovich. Ryan spots his book on the shelf and pulls it out, deligh SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy... SANFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wind Up Bird Chronicle. SALLY (turns to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan? RYAN (pleased)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you had this. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Well, yes.  It's extraordinary.  You think you could sign it for us? RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.  You always wonder where your books end up.  Why don't we use it? JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good idea. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's not a chance in hell anyone will get it... MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down by Law. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's not going to get that in fifteen seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe's team works on it's clues.  Teammates: Gina, Cal, Cl Skye, Monica, Jerry and Mary-Lynn.  Everyone is talking o each other and fighting for attention.  There are a lot o strong personalities here. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we... one at a time?  Hold it down, and one at a time.  You're last, Cal. CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why last? MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Katzenjammer Kids. There's a hush. MONICA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know.  It's the Funnies.  The Katzenjammer Kids.  It's my mother's favorite charade's clue.  No one ever gets it. Pause. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.  Good.  Fine, I vote for that. He writes it down. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a "Z."  K. A. T. Z. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the Pawn Hits the Conflicts He Thinks Like a King What He Knows... People hoot, throw their cocktail napkins. GINA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Utopia Parkway... They all start talking on top of each other again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teams have come together. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's keeping time? Mac raises his hand on Sally's side, Jerry on Joe's. JOE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two minutes. SALLY (deferring first turn to Joe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright.  Be our guests. She offers the hat. JOE (offers the hat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You darling. Panes reaches into the hat. PANES (reads clue; to Joe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? Joe whispers to him. PANES (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a sign for that? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Panes... JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Panes mimes a belly laugh. JEFFREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it Panes? Panes sighs. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two words. He belly laughs. JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny. A finger to his nose - elongate the word. SANFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funnies? Panes does an "ON THE NOSE."  Gets on all fours.  Licks h paws. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Katzenjammer Kids. The team applauds delight.  Panes preens.  Joe's team loo over at Monica. JERRY (already pissed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only just started.  Great.  The husband's on the other fucking team. Jerry reaches into the hat.  Looks at the clue. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Would you? MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was fifteen seconds. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you always this much fun? SALLY (a grin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your time, Jer. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready. He gives the clue "a song." CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Song. He gives "cycle." GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cycle. CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two words.  Second word. Jerry goes to work on "sounds like" for the word Jewish. Strokes beard, thinks, tries "sounds like" again. TEAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think.  Pain. CAL (among others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ponder. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, folks. CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First word. Jerry does the sign for the "short word." TEAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To, the, but, or... Jerry shakes his head.  Goes to the third word. TEAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third word.  One syllable. Jerry pulls his ear, "sounds like".  Slides his finger through the O created by his thumb and forefinger. TEAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck...sounds like... Fork.  Flock... he does the finger sign again. TEAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.  Folk. Jerry gives them "on the nose." TEAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second word. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty seconds. Jerry turns, gives them a dirty look. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jer.  Over here.  Over here. TEAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second word. He strokes his beard again. SKYE (blurts out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Jewish Folk Poetry. Jerry looks at her, amazed.  She stands, throws hands up triumph, does a little victory circle. The CAMERA CUTS through the rest of the game, aggressive, competitive, verging on hostile.  Sally is often aching f laughter, tears streaming down her face. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time.  Hey!  Time.  Judy!  Time you guys. Hey!! JUDY (she's up; turns to him, zeig heil's him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya Vhol.  What are you, a fucking Nazi? JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's fucking time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JERRY (CONT'D) (shouting guesses)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk.  Cripple.  Limp.  Ankle.  Second syllable.  Second syllable.  Move on to the fucking second syllable. Gina giving clues starts to laugh. JERRY (CONT'D) (sings out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock is ticking! Gina loses it, cracks up. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeffrey's on his feet, giving the clue. SALLY'S TEAM (unison)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quote.  Play. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.  It's one of Cal's.  Obscure Shakespeare, folks. Cal gives her a little wave from the other side. SOPHIA (CONT'D) (calls over to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe something original for a change. Cal blows her a kiss. SALLY'S TEAM (in unison)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten...twenty...thirty...seven, eight. Thirty-eighth word...thirty-seventh word. Gina's been taking shots through the course of the game, the FRAME will freeze black and white on one of another delicious moment.  There's a spectacular shot of Sally, unaware, laughing, sad soft eyes on Joe.

dialogues.speaker: AMERICA
dialogues.text: She watches the game from the archway, waits for a break. Sky's up.  Joe's team yells frantic guesses.  Jerry's suicidal. Sally's team watches, self-satisfied, throw barbed asides SALLY (to Joe's look; innocence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say a word. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time! JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it?  What the fuck was it? SALLY (small grin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan's novel. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan's novel? JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan's novel, Jerry. AMERICA (sings out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner! SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still champions. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panes is not on your team anymore. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I do? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panes is not on my team anymore.  I'll have Panes if I like. AMERICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an unfair advantage. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got Cal.  You've got Gina.  You've got Skye?  We're the leftovers. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, knock it off. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truce? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truce. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner. (on the move)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be angry. JOE (pissed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not fucking angry, for God's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evie and Jake run along the side of the house.  Behind th glass walls the CAMERA catches adults moving through the living room and into the dining room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most everyone's moved through to the dining room.  The ta is filled with platters of beautifully prepared food. Candles, flowers. ASTRID, newly arrived, carrying a miniature furball, of questionable breed, is first in line and halfway around t table.  She feeds "Anouk" bits from the table enroute. ASTRID (barely looks up as Sally comes into the room)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who won? SALLY (raises her hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A triumph.  When did you get here? ASTRID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten, fifteen minutes ago. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you come in? ASTRID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate the sight of blood.  You guys don't take prisoners. SKYE (charmed by the bundle in Astrid's arm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh how sweet. The furball bares teeth and growls. ASTRID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's insanely jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slips another morsel into Anouk's mouth, murmurs baby talk, allows the dog to take a bit of chicken from betwee her teeth. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's revolting, Astrid. People sit in small groups, eating dinner, catching up. Latecomers, bunch around Joe.  Sam Feckman, an actor also Mac's film, holds forth. Panes finds room next to Skye. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there space here? SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need anything else? SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no thanks. He sits on the floor along side her.  They eat in silence a moment. PANES (finally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was impressed. SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The charades. SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was my clue. SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shostakovich. SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?? PANES (does Seller's Indian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, indeed.  That was my clue, you see. Skye giggles appreciative response. PANES (CONT'D) (still Indian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you are well acquainted with this Shostackovich, as am I. Other arrivals pick their way through bodies and plates. Walk over to Sally and kiss her cheek.  Joe and Gina and Jeffrey sit off to the side. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate the idea of some one else living in it. Joe pulls Sally to him and wraps his arms around her. JOE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally's never even seen it.  I thought we'd raise our kids there. Sally held in Joe's arms, smiles.  The cat who ate the canary. JOE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I ever told you how Lucy and I nearly squashed each other getting into the dumb waiter. GINA/JEFFREY/SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes./Often./I stopped counting. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dumb waiter was our... GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escape hatch. JOE (eyes her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escape hatch.  And Dad was having a go about the garden.  Something was misplanted... SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not properly watered. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever! (to Gina)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how he gets.  Well, he went absolutely bonkers.  Lucy and I were frantically trying to scramble into the dumb waiter and I didn't fit any more. It was almost fatal.  And that, my dear friends, is the day... SALLY/JEFFREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realized I had become a man.  Ta da! GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a man, Joe.  You're a boy. JOE (childishly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? GINA (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Joe Therrian. SALLY (at a loss, small)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. Sophia watches from across the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Astrid squeezes in next to Sally, on her second portion o everything.  She allows Anouk to nibble from her plate. ASTRID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not upset that I brought the dog? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would it make a difference? ASTRID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anouk isn't like a dog, really.  More like a small person.  So is there anyone here for me?  No one looks new. (fixes on Ryan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want that.  It's married and it's the neighbor. ASTRID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I think he's cute.  How's the marriage part working out? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fucking desperate. ASTRID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you didn't know. (re: Skye)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who invited the bimbo? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA stays close on the cake as America wheels the into the living room.  The top of it sports Sally and Joe faces on either side of Otis, a detailed edible photograp There are three sixes across the top. There's a freed up pathway.  Cal taps the side of his champagne glass with a fork. SOPHIA (re: the cake as it comes in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of our gift.  Honey!! CAL (clinks his glass)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, here. Clair picks up discarded dinner plates.  Otis takes care those behind couches, under tables. The gifts are stacked high, near the fireplace.  Sally is the floor, nestled between Joe's knees, leaning back agai him.  His arms are wrapped around her, face pressed again hers. There's a SERIES OF CUTS through speeches, gifts, entertainment.  Sophia and Cal do a well rehearsed, very funny, impromptu something with their kids. Panes and Mac do an interpretive dance symbolizing the marriage. Cal and Sophia carry sleeping children down the hall. There are speeches about Sally and Joe, outrageously dirt funny, sometimes touching - that cover their recent separation, the custody of Otis, their trying to have a baby... Panes plays a piece on the violin.  Someone else sings. finally...

dialogues.speaker: SKYE
dialogues.text: She looks out at the guests...
