dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look back at her. SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't prepared to say anything.  I'm honored to be a part of tonight.  To be in the same room, with my favorite living actress... The CAMERA barely catches the grimace on Mac's face; Clai elbows him. SAM (sings out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still living. SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And my favorite novelist.  And all their amazing -- SAM (sings out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And talented. SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends.  And talented friends.  This room is so filled with love.. ASTRID (sings out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the winner is... PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let the woman speak. SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I brought a gift of love.  A gift that is love. She pulls an envelope from behind her back, which she's decorated in flower-child fashion; it harkens back to the sixties, puts it into Sally's hand, kisses her cheek. SKYE (CONT'D) (tears up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy anniversary.  Thank you for making me a part of it. SALLY (pours the pills into her hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they? JOE (pleased, surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolphins.  Great. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ecstasy, Sal. SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think there are sixteen there. JOE (kisses Skye)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an amazing present.  What a sweetheart you are. Skye's pleased she's made him happy. SALLY (regards Joe; to Skye)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a sweetheart you are. A pall descends on the party.  There's a FULL SHOT of the group.  Nobody quite knows what to do.  There's torn wrap paper all over the room. ASTRID (Anouk still in her lap)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late. (kisses Anouk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sleepy baby? There are awkward excuses.  Some of the guests leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The core group remains. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should all take it tonight. Everyone's staying, stays.  No driving. That's the rule.  I love you Sally-Mae. You're going to have a fabulous time. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm worried about my spine.  I'm very worried about my brain and my spine. SOPHIA (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh honey, you're gonna love it. JOE (to her Look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia's going to do it, Panes is going to do it, trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal carries the envelope into the room. CAL (on seeing America, bursts into)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: America, America God shed his light on me. He dances her around the kitchen, he picks up the sterlin dish, arranges the pills, carries them back to the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ecstasy is passed from guest to guest.  Ryan expects Moni to abstain. MONICA (his glare; simply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to try it, Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drug has begun to take effect.  The party is now in f swing.  Music is playing, and Sophia and Clair are dancin People are swimming, some naked, some in swimsuits.  Judy floats around the pool on an inflatable dog. Sally and Skye cuddle together on one of the benches roun the pool, chatting; a friendly, feely touchy conversation Joe passes around bottles of water and chewing gum to everyone, emceeing the event. Everyone is relaxed and open, except Ryan, who sits besid Monica at the edge of the garden, separated from the othe MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it here.  Don't you love it here, Ryan?  I love it here.  And I love tonight.  And I love these people.  And this feels utterly fantastic, Ryan. (touches her own cheek, ever so lightly; shivers against the sensation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Utterly fantastic. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what Sally Therrian was saying about your spine and your brain?  She didn't pull that out of thin air.  It causes brain damage.  You'd better drink a lot of water. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to go home, Ryan? RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should then.  You should look in on Sheila. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to leave you alone. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're really nice people, Ryan. They're like us... RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're nothing like us. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you need to speak for yourself, Ryan.  But I think you're really nice people... She puts arms around him, kisses his cheek.  He stiffens. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you making an ass of yourself? MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only you, Ryan.  You know what, Ryan?  You're beautiful.  I love you so much... You need... RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need a drug. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a good review and you'll be fine.  The whole color of the world will change, mark my words. She gets up. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to go? MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to go get my swimsuit.  I do know, Ryan, this is non addictive so you mustn't worry. (turns back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan, you're a great man. The CAMERA follows Monica along the side of the pool.  Sh passes Sophia and a very exuberant Clair. The CAMERA stays at the pool.  Clair tears off Sally's Galiano, flings it to the ground and dives topless into t pool. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This water is great! JERRY (swimming past her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna dive for a baton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands at the side of the pool. JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm about to throw five colored batons in the water.  Then I'm going to count to three, and then you may start diving.  I'm playing too.  The red one is ten extra points.  Ready? (she throws batons in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One, two, three, go!! There is a melee of diving and screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's at the end of a bridge, overlooking the pool.  Voice drift up from below.  Mac and Joe walk in circles pacing around one another. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got your DP? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Oh yeah, the camera man?  They gave me a list. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you got Skye Davidson.  Pretty big leagues for a first timer.  Do you even like movies? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not particularly.  Weird, isn't it?  God I'm rally up.  Do you feel anything yet, Mac? MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of.  Hey, look - John Seale, Oliver Stapelton, Darius Khonji - they're friends.  And great DP's I could give them a call for you. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mac. (regards him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And thanks for being so supportive about all this. (throws arm around him, hugs him close)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really love you, you know. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm happy for you, buddy.  Anything I can do. JOE (lets go of Mac)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I really need to jump about a bit. (begins jumping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your film going? CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going.  It's going. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how's the diva doing? MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know...good days, bad days. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant Sally. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant Sally. JOE (stops jumping, studies him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  You're serious. MAC (throws and arm around him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you something.  Directing's the best preparation possible for fatherhood.  The sleep depravation alone. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh don't.  Everyone says that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally's taken Gina's photograph of them from the mantelpi in the living room, and looks for a spot for it on the CD shelves.  Sophia is studying the CDs very intently.  They both bopping to the music. SALLY (re: the photograph)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't this a fabulous picture? SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's such a great photographer. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where should I put it? SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was okay where it was. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's much more personal in here. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A notch above the storage room. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're always in here. (regards the photo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She really gets him, doesn't she? SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The both of you. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she really gets to the heart of Joe, doesn't she?  She's a genius. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how much do you hate her? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big time. They both laugh, then... SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't trust her.  I never have. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She took our wedding photos, for chrissakes.  You don't trust anyone. SOPHIA (a moment simply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust you. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Soph... SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll hate it in London.  It's wet and miserable.  A medical hellhole Sally. It's socialized.  Beds in the corridors. Terrible plumbing. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the food sucks, I know. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not having your baby in London. You're going to have your baby at Cedars in Beverly Hills, America, delivered by Dr. Milton Cohen.  Period. And you're getting that epidural right away, don't let anyone talk you into any of that Lamase bullshit.  There's no excuse for pain like that. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia!  I'm not even pregnant! SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well good.  Thank God. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go in the kitchen and spy on everyone. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh honey, let's. They've started to walk through the house. SALLY (stops short; turns to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, thank God? SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, are you sure about this baby thing? It's not the ticking clock shit, is it? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, not at all... I mean I've still got plenty of time.  Don't I?  I mean I still have a good six years, whatever. We could have three kids yet, if we wanted.  And I know I've always said I never wanted kids, and I didn't... but this year, I really, truly, feel ready... SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I'm not worried about you.  You are going to be a fantastic mom.  Not an issue.  I pressed you, remember?  Joe, on the other hand, is a different story. SALLY (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Soph, Joe loves kids.  Joe wants kids. Joe thinks he needs kids. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants playmates.  Oh he's a sweetheart, Sal, you know I love him. But he's not going to be a good father. He's just not parenting material. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, let's sit down.  I bet the rug feels really nice against your skin. Sally drops out of frame. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't try and change the subject. (sitting, joining Sally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, it feels great!  He's just a little narcissistic, irresponsible and unreliable. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Cal's this massive adult? SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal knows who he is.  Did you notice how happy Joe was when the drugs came out tonight? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't exactly horrified. SOPHIA (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a drug problem. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither does Joe. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His sister does.  Big time.  And the New York Times says addiction is genetic -- I'll e-mail you the article. Sally stares at her friend suddenly mute, eyes wide. SOPHIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have kids to keep a marriage together, Sally.  It's only five months since Joe came back. SALLY (getting up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fine.  We're great.  We're having a baby and we're moving to London. SOPHIA (following her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you weren't fine last summer when you went Sylvia Plath on me in Connecticut. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not nice.  Not kind. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha!  Not half so not kind as your husband was in his portrayal of you in his novel. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this? SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His image of you is a possessive, fragile neurotic. SALLY (tearing up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I am a possessive, fragile neurotic. SOPHIA (also tearing up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you are not.  You're Sally Nash. Listen to me, you're Sally Nash.  You're my best friend and I love you more than anyone, and you're not going to move to London to have the offspring of a sexually ambivalent man-child.  "Oh now I'm a novelist, oh now I'm a director..." English prick bastard Joe Therrian who's probably going to leave you for Skye Davidson anyway. They hug a bit weepy. SOPHIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's always one step removed, always looking over his shoulder always looking for something else, something more intoxicating, and I don't mean drugs.  I love him, Sal, but he's a child.  He's not ready. (a choked sob, tears well and fall)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, you're so lucky you don't have kids.  You can't stick your head in the oven.  You can't take a handful of Percoden if you want to, or slit your wrists.  You can't do yourself in.  Kids rob you of that option.  Trust me. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, this ecstacy must be really good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe and Cal sit by the edge of the pool watching Skye dan by herself at the far end.  Joe has his hand on Cal's che Cal is stroking Joe's hair. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't Skye amazing? CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got great tits. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a constant surprise. CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you've only just met. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know... But she's only twenty seven and... (taps his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wisdom.  She's an old soul.  She knew that Shostakovich thing.  Did you notice? CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.  And she's got great tits. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, God she really does have great tits, great tits.  i can't wait to work with her. CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera loves her.  A great actress. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With great tits.  I'm going to ask her if I can touch them. He gets up to go towards Skye, is stopped by...

dialogues.speaker: CLAIR
dialogues.text: Clair is climbing up the pool steps. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has anyone seen Mac? JOE (pointing further up the property)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him wandering over there, I think. How're you feeling, Clair? CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so good. She kisses Joe and Cal, and goes off to find her husband. CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Mac.  It's been a bit of a struggle. I'm sure Sally's told you. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, what? CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The movie. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, she's really enjoying it.  I think. Is Mac okay? CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what's going on.  I don't care to guess.  Mac's really unhappy. She isn't there, that's all.  She's no idea what she's playing, not a clue. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who, Sally? CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, you know it isn't rocket science, this script.  She can barely get the lines out.  There was a scene last week - she sobbed, through every take.  I know crying's easy for her but it's a fucking comedy, Joe.  Something's gone.  You know, that thing that was Sally - that always surprised you.  It's gone.  I think she's scared.  And that's death. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still think she sails above the rest. I mean not like her early films.  But those were all such great directors. CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac's a pretty great director, Joe.  He's a woman's director.  And nothing's happening.  Course he won't fire her, because of the friendship... But it was discussed.  He had to battle his studio to get her in the first place. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, listen, I love her.  She's Sophia's best friend. (to Joe's stare)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never said any of this, alright.  I'll deny it on the stand... (into the silence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are gonna have kids.  That is so great.  Maybe that's what this is all about.  Maybe she doesn't want to do this anymore.  You know adults don't do this for a living.  You guys are gonna have your kids, you'll be directing -- one asshole in the family is enough.  Sophia knew that intuitively.  Look at Clair. Clair's a mess. (throws an arm around him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure she gets the epidural.  Forget that natural childbirth shit. Everything's going to be what it's supposed to be.  "Life is but a walking shadow.  A poor player who struts and frets his hour upon the stage and then is heard no more..." And speaking of me, the role of Leo in your film? JOE (stares at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo? CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any thoughts on casting yet? JOE (regards him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo?  It was out to Jude Law.  Jude passed. CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can't make any promises, and of course I haven't read the script but I loved the novel...when are you shooting? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: October-ish. CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a small window of time. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo.  Leo's twenty-eight, Cal. CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scratch the two, write in a four. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scratch the two, write in a four. CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a lot of fucking gall.  Thirty nine. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five years ago, I was at the party, remember? Joe looks up and sees Sally standing in the sun room.  He blows her a kiss.  She kisses her finger tips and puts he hand flat against the window pane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in her wardrobe pacing back and forth a bit frantic Trying on clothing, tossing garments to the ground.  The floor is a heap of discarded ideas.  She pulls on jeans a t-shirt.  Very similar to what Skye is wearing.  She sits moment on the floor.  The sounds of the party below are muted. SALLY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Warren, that was awful, I can't sing. The CAMERA stays with Sally as she gets to her feet, walk along the corridor, toward the sound of her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac is on the edge of the couch, elbows on knees, staring the television screen - watching his dailies.  At some po he drops his head.  Stops watching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAL'S VOICE FROM THE T.V. (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sing like a bird. SALLY'S VOICE FROM THE T.V. (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bird with dropsy.  A caged bird.  That hasn't long to live. CAL'S VOICE FROM THE T.V. (O.S)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem so alive up there. Sally stands at the open door.  Stunned.  Watches Mac wat her.  Watches herself, with a professional, acute eye.  M critical than Mac's could ever be. SALLY (ON TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was faking it.  I've been feeling caged for sometime.  Funny, huh? MAC (moans)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not... Fuck fuck fuck fuck.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: She backs up into the corridor mortified.  Leans against wall. CAL'S VOICE FROM THE T.V. (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's preposterous.  You're free to do whatever you like. SALLY'S VOICE FROM THE T.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, well, we'll see won't we? MAC (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. SALLY (a deep breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...wow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clair's started down the hallway, reaches the landing.  S rushes into the guest bedroom to avoid her.  Clair, just missing Sally, wanders into the dailies room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac?  Oh there you are.  What are you doing, honey?  No more work.  Don't you feel breezy. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in mourning. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can cut around it, whatever it is. You always do. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this time. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's always not this time.  If you can do it around me, you can do it around anyone. She walks in front of the television set, blocks it with body, switches it off. MAC (an observation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have any clothes on. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How nice for everybody.  Come swimming. The water's glorious. (re: the film)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll fix it.  You'll come up with one of your brilliant ideas. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or I won't.  I can't help her.  I'm out of my depth. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things always look much worse in the morning. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how to make her funny. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're coming swimming in the pool, and in a few minutes you won't even remember what it's about.  You won't care who's in your damn movie. MAC (really stoned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What what's about? CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...wait, what are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Evie are asleep across the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally sits at the edge of the bed, regards the sleeping children.  Reaches over and smoothens the tangled, tousle hair.  Studies their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica sits on the steps of the pool.  She looks frighten uncomfortable. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.  I feel.  I feel a bit funny. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go for a walk. He puts his arm around her and leads her away from the po

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never done this before. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?  It's easy.  You just put one foot in front of the other... That's a good girl. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a little in the puke zone. JOE (giving her some water)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, drink this.  Drink lots of water. (puts the bottle in her hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on to this.  Take deep breaths. Nice and slow. (sits her down; produces a lollipop)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a lolly? MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I, five? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're never too old for a lolly.  I'm having one. MONICA (a grin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. He pulls out another one. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemon or raspberry? MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemon. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemon it is. The two suck on their lollipops for a moment. MONICA (finally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan's really angry with me. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's really angry with me too. MONICA (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really not the same thing. (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was really nicer when he drank. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight years, though.  That's quite an accomplishment. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lot of those. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medallions. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of cakes. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he doesn't smoke? MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has to find non-smoker's meetings that used to be almost impossible, you know? It's gotten much better. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been married? MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine...nine, yes?  Nine years, just about. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must have been a baby. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes.  Nineteen...just. (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm cold. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here. Joe holds Monica. MONICA (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very nice. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so glad.  You know, I recognize that passage in your book.  The bit about us running into each other in the movie theatre. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry? MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you changed it to a bookstore. And the color of my hair.  But the moment was exactly the same.  The same, you know, dynamic.  And almost verbatim, wasn't it? JOE (humors her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was.  For a writer nothing's sacred. (thinks a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, nothing at all. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's great that I made an impression at all, you know. Joe regards the open trusting face, is touched by it.  Le in, kisses her lips very lightly... and again.  Her arms can't make up her mind, whether to come up around him or Finally do. SALLY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otis!!  Otis, come!  Oh fuck! She appears beside them. SALLY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone left the goddamn gate open.  Otis got out.  Skye and I, well the... I came out of the house and the fucking gate was wide open. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh for fuck's sake.  Nobody uses that gate. MONICA (horrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. SALLY (raging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a goddamn sign on the gate. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking cow, can't you read?! MONICA (at a loss)

dialogues.speaker: I...
dialogues.text: SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long ago was it? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop being such a bitch, Sal. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a mistake.  This isn't a plot to do in Otis. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be so sure. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to yourself... (to Monica)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, it's alright.  We'll find him. (to Sally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you? SALLY (re: Monica)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She left the fucking gate open. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he can't have gone far. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't have gone far?  He's like a greyhound.  He could be miles away. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll find his way back. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are fucking coyotes out there. JOE (calming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally, calm down.  We're not going to find him any quicker by you being hysterical. Monica retreats, backs off a step or two. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or shitty!!  Otis!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: America and Rosa are cleaning up.  Ryan hangs around chatting. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you worked for the Therrians? AMERICA (shrugs, polite but annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long time. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you were here when they were doing the work on the boundary fence? AMERICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know the contractor? AMERICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it a contractor? AMERICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the way they do things. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To code? Her back is to him.  She exchanges a glance with Rosa, an the Spanish equivalent of "who is this wanker?" RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see permits?  Did he have a license? AMERICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should talk to Mr. Joe. Monica bursts into the room. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan, you've got to come!  You've got to help me find the dog!  I let their dog out.  We need to find the dog. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not serious. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left the gate open and Otis got out! He could get hit by a car! RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God willing. MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to find the dog, Ryan. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? MONICA (regards him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we're nice people, and because what goes around comes around. (desperate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because, God help you if something happens to that dog? RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the ugly phone calls?  We're not the only people with a tape recorder, Ryan. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've gone to the canyon, we should go towards the PCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panes and Skye search the canyon for Otis.  They both car lanterns. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otis!!  Shostakovich identified with the Jew.  He felt persecuted, hunted, crushed under the thumb of Stalinist imperialism. SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to mention Andrew Zhdanov... Otis, come!! PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre Zhdanov?  How the hell do you know about Andre Zhdanov? SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who doesn't know about the infamous composer's conference of 1948 where Zhdanov persecuted the leaders of Soviet Music - Shostakovich, Prokofieve, and Myaskovsky. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you who doesn't know, cute girls don't know. SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do Peter Sellers again. PANES (a la Sellers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otis you crazy dog!  Otis are you in this God forsaken Canyon?  My people are very hungry. SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just did a movie about Bob Yar, I played Gittle, the Jewish milkmaid who gets shot in the head, and they used Shostakovich's 13th Symphony. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set to the poem of Yetveshenko! SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly!  So I dug it, and I did a lot of research. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really, you really, like Shostakovich? SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you, like, marry him? SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he were still alive, maybe. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about someone who really really liked Shostakovich? SKYE (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you asking me to marry you? PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm just testing to see how deeply perverted and impulsive you are. SKYE (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh good, I'm worse... Are you really twenty-two? SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you that?  No.  I'm twenty... (lops off two years)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally and Joe have lanterns.  Panes and Skye are up ahead We hear them calling for Otis. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otis!!!! JOE (on her heels)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otis!!!! SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otis, good boy, come here.  Oh my god, oh my god, oh my god. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a nightmare.  We should have kept him upstairs. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was done.  When Sophia put the kids to bed, America brought Otis in the room and closed the door.  It was done. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well someone clearly let him out before Monica opened the gate. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh fuck you, and fuck Monica while you're at it.  But I guess that's what I interrupted. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Sally.  You are a medical miracle. The only person who's ever taken ecstacy and become angrier. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, let's talk about that.  You seem to be rather an expert.  I don't remember in the last five months of counselling your ever mentioning ecstacy or going to rage parties. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rave parties?!  That's so typical - you would think it was called rage.  Perfect! SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else don't I know about, Joe?  Let's get really clear here. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally, so I took a few pills.  I went out dancing.  I tried to forget how upset I was about splitting up with you.  I haven't lied to you.  I told you about the people I've slept with.  I just didn't mention the few occasions I took drugs because you're so fucking judgmental I knew I'd never hear the end of it, and you have so little faith and so little trust in me.  Sally, we're back, I love you.  Trust that.  Please let's not do this. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otis!  Come!  Good boy!  Come! JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otis! SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure we understand that word in the same way. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You walked out on a five year marriage. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That hasn't the first fucking thing to do with love.  It's whether we can live together... like this!  All the time. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not like this all the time. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DO I want anyone else?  No.  Do I want to be with you for the rest of my natural life?  I'm trying. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how hard it hit? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stop right there, Sally.  We've been through this. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been through it.  That's how you love people.  When it's easy for you, when it's convenient for you. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally, first of all, you're talking bullshit.  And second... SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to talk about bullshit?  Lucy called you three times this week.  She's a fucking mess, Joe.  Your sister is a fucking mess.  She needs you.  I talk to her more than you do. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is not true. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is true.  You know how you love, Joe? You dedicate a book to someone. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every novel I've had published in every language I've dedicated to Lucy. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  And when was the last time you spoke to her? Joe is silent. SALLY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how fucking dare you cast Skye Davidson in that part?  Have you any idea how humiliating that is for me?  I'm an actress!  It's about our marriage for fuck's sake.  Everybody knows that... JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a novel. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About me! JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck do you think you are?  The part of Genna is not just about you. It's about every woman I've ever loved in my entire life.  Including my mother. The character is also clearly in her early twenties, Sally. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?  Last birthday was? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't look my age, Joe. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally, I have never considered you for this part because you are too old to play it.  And you are out of touch with reality if you think differently. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a shit novel anyway. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well there you go.  I let you off the hook.  You're one goddamn lucky actress. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.  I mean your books have always been pop, but this is the shallowest of the bunch.  That's what all our friends think, anyway. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  If we could've, by some miracle, stripped ten years off your face, still couldn't have got the thing made. Because I don't mean anything as a director, and your name doesn't mean fuck all anymore.  And the people that can hire you are afraid to, because they think you're phoning it in.  That you don't have... Oh Christ, Sally. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?  Who?  Who thinks that? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your director and your co-star of your current movie.  Don't dish if you can't take it, Sally. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac?  Mac says it?  Cal? Joe doesn't respond. SALLY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal, too? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally, for Christ's sake. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone else? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is insanity. (moves toward her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally... SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't push me away. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had an abortion two weeks ago. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found out I was pregnant and it scared the shit out of me. JOE (threatens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this! SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you when we met I never wanted children.  I don't want kids in my life. We talked about it.  You weren't listening. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You changed your mind. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted you back. Joe slaps her hard across the face. SALLY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this was to hurt you?!  My God, Joe.  It isn't about you. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!  You aborted our child?! SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a monster.  Exactly. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not ready. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make allowances.  I'll never be ready.  Some people just shouldn't have children.  I'd be a terrible fucking mother, Joe.  I did want it for us.  But I couldn't do it.  I don't really think I can do it. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't part of that picture at all, was I?  I wasn't part of that decision.  Did I occur to you at all?  It's a fucking farce.  It's a fucking farce.  How long did you think you could keep it going. You're amazing.  Do you have any idea what you've done to us? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never forgive you. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea who you are. They stand their in silence.  Joe is devastated.  We hear Skye and Panes up ahead calling for Otis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of Mac, Judy and Clair.  Mac directs an underwater ballet la Esther Williams. There's a sequence of TIGHT OVERLAPPING SHOTS of Mac, smiling, swimming underwater.  His image of himself... SL compounded by water-weight. The drug has clearly taken effect.  Mac opens his mouth t direct his actors, forgets where he is, begins to choke, cough, is clearly in trouble. Oblivious, Judy and Clair turn somersaults. Mac begins to panic.  He is drowning. He begins to sink.  Panic gives way to acceptance. Jerry's body flies past FRAME, splashes hard into the poo The LENS is water-splattered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry's body sweeps past the lens, smooth and sleek as a Dolphin.  He grabs Mac...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry pulls Mac to the surface.  Clair and Judy are out o the pool.  Jerry drags the limp body from the pool, pumps Mac's chest - it's clear he knows what he's doing.  Mac coughs up a load of water. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.  Honey??? There's a moment.  Mac begins to sob. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's okay, Clair.  You wanna give him a little room? MAC (his face against concrete)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I must really be stoned. (wipes tears from his face with his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, buddy. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey? Mac raises his hand, arrests her from coming nearer. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine, babe. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him a minute, Clair. MAC (humiliated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. (looks over at Jerry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, buddy. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anytime, sport. MAC (wants to say "don't call me sport")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks pal. CLAIR (helpless)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey? They all stand around watching him.  Mac gets up. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine, babe.  I'm gonna take a little walk.  I need a minute.  Let's forget it. My life didn't pass in front of my eyes. So, it probably wasn't that close. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably not. MAC (to Jerry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you've got lifeguard papers, or what? JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a test, you know. JERRY (embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it, Judy. CLAIR (still scared)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey? MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be fine.  Really babe.  Give me a minute. The CAMERA stays on Mac as he walks around the side of th house, down the steps through the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac begins to tremble, sob convulsively.  He bites down o his lip, clinches his first, tries to pull himself togeth MAC (paces; at himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're okay.  Buck up.  Come on, be a man.  It could happen to anybody. (tears start again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't stop, I'm going to punch your face in. (another moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a towel off a stack and they all fall on the flo MAC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.  I can't fucking do anything right.  Come on, come on.  Oh thank you God for giving me this chance.  Thank you for having Jerry here to save me.  I promise I will never cheat on my wife again.  I will never take drugs again, and I will be a great fucking husband and a loving father.  I am a great father!  I have terrific friends.  I am a brilliant director.  Well-respected.  I won a Golden Globe, how 'bout that?  Yeah, man, it's alright, it's alright, it's alright. And God, I will be humble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina regards the photographs she brought for Joe and Sall She lifts it from the shelf, the phone rings, the machine picks up. MAN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, Joe!  It's your Dad!  Pick up, Joe... Gina sets the photo on the desk, leans it up against the wall.  Joe and Sally's faces stare out of it. GINA (picks up receiver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, hi, it's Gina!  Gina.  Is everything alright? (a deep intake of breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.  When?  He's not here. They're out looking for Otis.  The dog, Harry. (tears start down her face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you so much.  Lucy's a fighter, she'll make it.  Whether she wants to or not.  Harry.  I'm so sorry.  I will. (writes down the number)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I will.  Take care, Harry.  Bye. She puts down the phone.  Stares into Joe's face, looks u a photo on the wall that she took of Joe and Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry and Judy are making out. JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you my big brave boy?  Are you my brave hero? JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy baby.  I love you. JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you my big hard hero? JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to save you?  Do you want me to save you? JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah... JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah... I'm gonna save you. JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me heal you, baby. JUDY (mantra)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus oh Jesus oh Jesus. Grunts, groans, a scream, a peel of giggles. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina pulls Joe's clothes out of the closet, out of the drawers.  There's an overnight bag on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal and Sophia lie cuddled on a lounge chair, blissed out counting the windows of the house. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...no, no, start again. CAL AND SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One, two, three, four... Clair wanders up.  She's changed into her own clothes. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've lost my husband and my beeper.  Have either of you seen either of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clair, Mac, Sophia, Cal and Gina are waiting.  The overni bag rests near the coffee table.  No one speaks. There are sounds of the search party approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panes, Skye, Sally and Joe come into the room dogless. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go upstairs, okay? Joe looks from Gina to the others. GINA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go upstairs. They move out of the room. SALLY (on the way upstairs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it Otis? Skye and Panes look at the other guests. SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina closes the door. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The suspense is killing me. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry called. JOE (growing dread)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And? GINA (there's now way to say it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy overdosed. JOE (a long moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's alright. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in ICU. Joe's legs give way.  He sort of sits on the floor. JOE (laughs; shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid tart. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She left a note. JOE (realizes the import; to Gina)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Tears start down Sally's face. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to call your dad. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave us alone right now. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've booked you a flight and packed you a bag.  You just need to get into a car and go. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you leave us alone right now? GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love her too, Joe. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, good.  Thanks for your trouble. So will you leave Sally and me alone right now? SALLY (a shrug; simply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody hates the messenger. Gina exits. SALLY (CONT'D) (to Joe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming with you. Joe starts to cry.  Sally holds him, kisses him, strokes rocks him. JOE (inconsolable)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to go. He wipes tears away that start afresh; his nose is runnin he wipes that too. JOE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't got tonight.  I don't want to be on a plane on my own tonight. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be with you. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to go tonight. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to. They sit on the floor.  Sally soothing, rocking Joe like baby. JOE (bereft)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid tart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina's put up some coffee.  Sophia, Cal, Mac and Clair st around awkwardly.  Sally comes into the room. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's he doing? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not good. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna miss his flight. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Al the guests are a little stunned. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he not going?  I booked a flight. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not going tonight. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told his father he'd be on that flight. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you could tell him otherwise.  It was good of you to be all this help.  But he doesn't want to go tonight. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Sally.  I'm not the enemy. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're not the wife. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a contest. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn straight. CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I go up? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want us to stay? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not. MAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much for ecstacy, right? They all laugh a little. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get the kids. CLAIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, the sitter. SALLY (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Clair, you're so... You know.  You just put things in perspective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe listens to the answering machine message Lucy left th morning.  He plays it again and again. HE fast forwards to his father's voice.  Presses the STOP button.  Sits there, stunned. JOE (dials phone, a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal and Sophia bundle up their sleeping kids.  The CAMERA follows them to the landing as they head downstairs, pass Sally who is coming up. SOPHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to be home all weekend, call if you need anything. Sally kisses Cal's cheek. CAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panes and Skye are fucking on Joe and Sally's bed.  Sally walks in on them searching for Panes' ear, her best buddy SALLY (resigned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh perfect!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry and Judy lie alongside each other, hands propping heads.  They aren't privy to anything that's happened. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I call that a perfect day. JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A perfect night. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn near. (long moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a damn near perfect drug. JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm.  We should do it again. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just every once in a blue moon, you know. JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm. (a long moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think we should ask them for their landscaper? JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm.  Do you like fucking out of doors? JUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not as a rule. JERRY (a long moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't sign their goddamn tax returns!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally stands at the threshold, watches Cal and Sophia loa their kids into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clair and Mac and Gina hug and say their goodbyes to Sall GINA (kisses Sally; whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take good care of it. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Count on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica and Ryan return from their unsuccessful search.  T come through the gate with it's sight: KEEP GATE CLOSED. Monica and Ryan start for the kitchen entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally and Joe are alone in the room.  They hold each othe weep... RYAN (appalled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, it's a fucking dog! MONICA (regards them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go in, Ryan. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? MONICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just go home, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A much embarrassed Panes and Skye enter. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. PANES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it. Panes starts to make some; Skye starts to clean up glasse and ashtrays. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to do that. SKYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mind... SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax.  You've done enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Judy and Jerry bounding around the side of the hou Jerry has his briefcase in his hand.  They are laughing. They enter the kitchen.  The camera stays outside.  We se them brought up short by the gloom, but hear nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally and Joe are at the table, signing their tax returns Jerry supervising.  All is quiet.  Judy's sunk into a cha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning's finally come.  Light fills the room, empty exce for party debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's empty but for glasses, wrapping paper, abandoned dis of leftover cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bed is rumpled and indented from the sleeping childre Their drawings and paints strewn all over the floor...and Walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bed still shows the remains of Panes and Skye's love making. The CAMERA moves through the suite into the bathroom. Sally's in the tub.  Joe comes into the room in the buff. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come in? Sally looks up at the nakedness. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. HE slips into the tub with her.  They lie there facing ea other. OE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My plane leaves in a few hours. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Do you want me to come with you? JOE (simply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. JOE (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty much a disaster, tonight, wasn't it? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life gets messy.  Ugly messy.  But I don't understand you.  And I don't think I ever understood Lucy.  I don't understand throwing it away.  How do you throw all that away?  Any of it.  I want it all.  You guys want guarantees?  I want the possibilities.  And all kinds of crap comes with that.  A lot of bad shit. And I think that's okay with me because, because of the rest of the stuff.  All the good shit.  All the surprises.  It's a fucking miracle when you come down to it. (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd have had amazing children, you and me.  We'd have had a ride.  You'd have surprised yourself. (regards her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never love anybody else, you know. SALLY (a little choked laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's under lock and key. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. Joe reaches out of the tub for gift-wrapped box.  He hand to sally.  It's their ritual gift-giving site. Sally opens the gift.  Takes out a Calder mobile. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy anniversary. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Calder. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my favorite. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  It's for the baby's crib. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... She hands him a small wooden box.  He opens it, takes out set of keys. SALLY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're the keys to your grandad's flat. Happy anniversary, baby. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Sally Mae... He can't say anymore. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you make love with me? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. She reaches out with both arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe and Sally tenderly make love.  It's the dissolution o their marriage. INT. FOYER - NINE A.M. America and Rosa begins to clean up the debris from the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A taxi pulls up.  Joe gets in with his bags.  The cab bac out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two wedding rings rest on the nightstand, hers nestle his.  Sally's hand opens the drawer, sweeps the rings int it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "FOR SALE" sign is hammered into the ground.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Otis wanders along the street, up the driveway and disapp through the flap in the kitchen door.
